name: biomni-analyze-arsenic-speciation-hplc-icpms
title: Biomni: Analyze Arsenic Speciation HPLC ICP-MS
description: Analyzes arsenic speciation in liquid samples using HPLC-ICP-MS technique
content:
Overview

Analyzes arsenic speciation in liquid samples using High-Performance Liquid Chromatography coupled with Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry (HPLC-ICP-MS). This advanced analytical technique separates and quantifies different arsenic species, enabling researchers to distinguish between toxic inorganic arsenic forms (As(III) and As(V)) and less toxic organic forms (methylated arsenicals).

Input Parameters

  • sample_data (required): List of HPLC-ICP-MS measurement data points containing retention times and arsenic signal intensities
  • sample_name (optional, default: 'Unknown Sample'): Identifier for the sample being analyzed
  • calibration_data (required): Calibration curve data for quantification of arsenic species concentrations

Biological Use Case

Essential for microbiology and environmental research involving:

  • Arsenic biotransformation studies by microorganisms
  • Assessment of microbial arsenic methylation capabilities
  • Environmental remediation monitoring with arsenic-metabolizing bacteria
  • Toxicity studies of arsenic species in microbial cultures
  • Biogeochemical arsenic cycling in contaminated sites

Output

Generates a comprehensive analysis report (arsenic_speciation_results.txt) containing:

  • Identified arsenic species and their retention times
  • Quantified concentrations for each arsenic species
  • Total arsenic concentration
  • Species distribution percentages
  • Quality control metrics and calibration information

Category

microbiology
